alert.note: Alert for Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 5:24PM EST until December 19 at 1:51PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central and southern New Jersey, including the following counties, in central New Jersey, Monmouth. In southern New Jersey, Ocean. * WHEN...Until midnight EST tonight. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 523 PM EST, Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the warned area, including the non-tidal portions of the Manasquan and Metedeconk Rivers. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - For Manasquan at Allenwood: At 4:15pm the stage was 14.73 feet. Flood Stage is 14.5 feet. ... For N. Branch Metedeconk River at Lakewood: At 4:15pm the stage was 7.55 feet. Flood Stage is 8 feet. ... For Manasquan at Squankum: At 5:00pm the stage was 9.31 feet. Flood Stage is 8.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
